body:
> we can use the localStorage request ID with LoadingOverlays to hide/show loading spinners in relevant sections

This is actually ties to my main issue: since localStorage is a synchronous API, there will never be a chance to show a loading spinner here. LocalStorage blocks until the data is available, so React doesn't get a chance to re-render. If this were localForage, which is an asynchronous API, it would be fine. I tested this by artificially making the localStorage fetch take several seconds (by fetching 10000 times form local storage). This just makes the page hang on a white screen for a while.

Having the flexibility to switch to another backend is nice, but would also be easy to add later. I don't think we should use request/response for synchronous actions.
